thread.title: Medical assistant set to plea in prescription pill mill case
thread.title_full: Medical assistant set to plea in prescription pill mill case - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Medical assistant set to plea in prescription pill mill case
text:
GULFPORT, Miss. (AP) - Court records show one of two employees accused along with a Waveland doctor of running a prescription pill mill out of medical office has filed a notice of her intent to enter a guilty plea.
The Sun Herald reports ( http://bit.ly/1jxiwy6 ) 59-year-old Petty Laporte is set to enter the plea Oct. 28. She is facing a maximum sentence of 20 years.
She and two others, Dr. Steve Morris III and another of his employees, 29-year-old Brittany Spikes were arrested May 13 after federal and local authorities raided the doctor's office on May 13.
A federal grand jury indicted all three on federal charges of conspiracy and aiding and abetting one another to possess, distribute and dispense controlled substances outside the scope of a medical practice.
Information from: The Sun Herald, http://www.sunherald.com
